title: For Sale:  Ruger Police Service Six 357 Magnum 4"
location: Southeast side of Indianapolis, Indianapolis, Indiana
postcontent: I have a Ruger Police Service Six chambered in 357 Magnum with a 4" barrel for sale.  It is in excellent mechanical condition.  It locks up extremely tight, like the cylinder is welded kind of tight.  The trigger is smooth and crisp, especially in single action.  The blued finish is in about 95% condition, with a few spots of minor (very minor) pitting.  It has a vintage '80s Hogue Monogrip on it.  It is plastic, as opposed to the newer rubber Hogue grips.  It is very comfortable.  The grip is missing the screw that attaches it, as well as the "saddle" part that goes on the bottom of the frame for the screw to screw into.  You can get both parts directly from Hogue for cheap; I called them to see.  Even without the screw holding the grip on, it is a very tight fit on the gun.  It feels like it IS attached with a screw.  You could probably shoot it as it is without the grip shifting, but that is your call.  I am asking $350 for this gun.  Call or text me (text is preferable) at 317-529-seven two nine nine.  Text is preferable, and I can text you more pics of it as well.  I want to sell this gun face to face, as I have never had a good experience trying to ship a pistol.

A Tradition of Excellence, like No Other. Ruger Mark III pistols represent the evolution of Ruger .22 LR pistols, continuing the legacy created by the Ruger Standard, Mark I and Mark II pistols and yet incorporating many new engineering refinements. They are simple, rugged, and affordable, making them a great value for any sporting purpose - whether target shooting, plinking or small game hunting.

The Ruger Mark III Hunter includes rigid barrel/receiver connection; automatic bolt-hold-open latch; comfortable, rugged steel grip frame; contoured ejection port; easy-to-grasp tapered bolt ears; and rigidly mounted sights for consistent accuracy. Simply stated, Mark III Pistols offer the most versatility and value of any rimfire pistol on the market today.

FEATURES:
- Patented loaded chamber indicator provides visual and tactile indication that chamber is loaded.
- Accurate sighting system features light-gathering HiViz  fiber optic front sight (with six interchangeable LitePipes) , precision-adjustable rear sights and drilled and tapped receiver for Weaver-style scope base adapters (included FREE) for easy mounting of optics.
- Smoothly contoured, comfortable grip features natural pointing grip angle with checkered grip panels providing a non-slip hold. The manual safety and magazine release are conveniently located on the left side of the frame.
- Manual safety positively locks the sear when applied. Also features an unobtrusive internal lock that locks the safety in the “SAFE” position and allows you to safely secure the firearm when not in use.
- Magazine disconnect prevents discharge when the magazine has been removed.
- Internal cylindrical bolt construction: ensures permanent alignment and higher accuracy potential than conventional moving-slide designs.

title: For Sale:  Savage 24 22lr/.410
postcontent:
Didn't really know where to list this cool little gun, either shotgun or rifle? 
Here's a classic Savage 24 22lr over 3inch .410. The gun has been around my family as long as I can remember and has probably dispatched more squirrels than most. It's in good condition for being nearly 50 years old and hunted a lot. There are some specs of bluing loss and freckling on the barrels, but the receiver and case hardening look great. It has the side selector as opposed to the trigger-spur selector for the barrels which makes this version more desirable. There is about a half dollar sized patch of missing finish and dent on the left side of the stock. 

It still shoots and functions perfectly, and I managed to collect a couple bushy tails this past weekend in Naugatuck (one with the 410 and another with the 22). 

It's be a great gun for teaching kids with CB's, or for one you sentimental folks looking for a gun you used to have.

Sorry for the pictures being cruddy. I'm not great at this photography thing. 

$375 OBO. I'll travel a reasonable distance. This is way cooler than that goofy looking plastic version they just came out with. Prefer not to trade at this point unless you've got a Remington 600 350 rem mag, Remington Model 8 .35 rem, or Model 71 in .348 (I'd obviously add cash on my end).

Thanks for checking it out

title: For Sale:  DPMS .223 Prairie Panther King's Desert Shadow
location: 1367 Velp Ave Green Bay, Wisconsin, United States
postcontent:
The whole idea with the Prairie Panther was that DPMS wanted the lightest most accurate rifle they could make for calling and stalking. DPMS used a lightened version of the stainless DCM match barrel and the 20" with the 1x8 twist made the most sense for the intended purpose.

The difference in handling between the 18" and 20" is almost non existent, also the extra velocity with 2” more barrel helps with the heavier bullets. In fact most people that were shown the rifle thought it had a 18" barrel! Picture does not represent upgrades.

Barrel:
- 20" Length Target Crowned

title: For Sale:  X COAT GLOCK 26 *NEW IN BOX*
postcontent:
Brand new x-coated Glock 26 9mm

The barrel is coated, not just the slide.  

•NiB-X offers a unique combination of wear resistance and a low 
•coefficient of friction (superb lubricity).  There are harder surface 
•treatments available (but they have no lubricity) and there are more 
•lubricious coatings (teflon scratches off) but there are no coatings 
•that optimize this combination of performance attributes like NiB-X. 
•The NiB-X process does not affect the part through excessive 
•temperatures like some other technologies you may consider.  And there 
•is no hydrogen embrittlement of the part due to the process.  The 
•maximum process temperature is 195F with an optional post coating 
•precipitation bake to further harden the coating performed at 450F.  All
•temperatures are low enough as to not be detrimental to your parts.
•NiB-X is harder than chrome and has a Rc70 hardness.  This is much 
•harder than Nickel Teflon (~Rc45), and MeloniteTM  (Rc55).  The process 
•temperature for Melonite and other salt bath nitrocarburizing is 1050F 
•and too high for many components.  PVD coatings are harder than NiB-X 
•but are only a couple microns thick and do not have the low coefficient 
•of friction.  NIB-X provides higher reliability operation for longer 
•durations and allows for reduced maintenance and easier clean up.  
•Nickel Boron nitride is essentially electroless nickel with boron 
•nitride mixed in the matrix, very similar to the Nickel Teflon process. 
•Whereas NiB-X is a single coating and structure throughout the 
•thickness, Nickel Teflon and Nickel Boron Nitride are duplex layers with
•a layer of electroless nickel and then a thin layer of EN+Teflon or EN+
•Boron Nitride (.0001”-.0002”).  Once the telfon or boron nitride wears 
•off you are down to only electroless nickel.

title: For Sale:  Remington Arms, 1903A1 Springfield
postcontent:
This Remington was produced in July of 1942, Every part on the metal has been properly marked "R". After doing a lot of research and corresponding with Remington Historians, I indeed have a 1942 all original Remington. It has a Keystone Field Replacement Stock on her, and the stock is Measured as a "C" Stock. The bore is one of the best of the 1903's that I've seen. The Serial number begins with 318, XXX. It is not a "Modified" A1 but simply a 1903 A1. I've shot standard military M1 ammo through her and am able to achieve a 2" group at one hundred yards. The muzzle and breach are in excellent condition. The Remington front sight hood is included with the rifle, as it came out of the crate with this hood attached. Excellent War Piece

I can provide a picture of every single part on the firearm for a full inspection of its markings.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Smith & Wesson 14-2 Target Masterpiece
postcontent:
Up for sale or trade is my Smith & Wesson model 14-2 “Target Masterpiece” chambered in .38 Special. This revolver has a 6” barrel, adjustable target sights and checkered “diamond” target stocks. The steel is blued and in remarkable condition. The bore of this revolver is bright and the rifling is sharp. Serial number starts with K7615xx. This is an earlier gun, probably produced in the mid 1960’s. Pinned barrel, firing pin on the hammer, the real deal. These are the most accurate revolvers ever made. When firing this revolver in double action everything is butter smooth, lock up is tight, timing is perfect. When shooting single action the trigger is very light with no creep or play. Using light target loads and wadcutters this is an ego booster. It is also the perfect handgun for teaching beginners. I own several of these or this one would be staying with me.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Smith & Wesson 10-6
postcontent:
Up for sale or trade is my Smith & Wesson Model 10-6 chambered in .38 Special. This revolver has a 4” bull barrel and Pachmayr rubber grips. This pistol has been carried much more than it has been shot and it shows. The blued steel has holster wear, however this is a very clean gun. There is no lead build up around the forcing cone, no rust and absolutely no pitting. The bore is bright and shiny. The rifling is sharp. The action on this revolver is as smooth as silk in double action and the trigger is light as a feather in single action. The trigger breaks like a glass rod. Lockup is tight and the timing is correct. The serial number is D3377xx. This pistol is pre-lock, has a hammer mounted firing pin and a pinned barrel. The way things should be! With smooth ramp sights and six rounds of .38 special this old revolver will continue to serve as a glove box gun, outdoor companion or just be a good old plinker. A .38 revolver with light loads is one of the best ways to introduce new shooters to the world of handgunning.

title: For Sale:  Mossberg 464 SPX Tactical Lever-Action 30-30
postcontent:
I am selling my brand new, never fired Mossberg 464 SPX tactical lever action 30-30 rifle. I just purchased the rifle a few weeks ago because I fell in love with it at the gun show, but now I would rather put the money down for a collector's edition rifle I've had my eye on for a while that just became available again. Still, it's a fantastic gun for home defense or hunting - I really like how versatile it is.

The gun has a six-position adjustable, synthetic stock, tri-rail forend with ladder rail covers,  and the receiver is drilled and tapped to mount optics. It also has a flash suppressor, fiber optic 3-dot sights, 16.25" barrel with matte finish, and 1:10 inch twist rate. It has a 5 round capacity. This particular gun is the "zombie edition," a rare version that has the "ZMB" decal on the side of the receiver (I was going to rub that off and Duracoat the receiver if I kept it, but that's up to you now). Price is $450 (MSRP is $555). Thanks for the interest.

postcontent:
Up for sale or trade is my Sig Sauer P232 chambered in .380 ACP (or 9mm Kurtz). This pistol has a 3.6” barrel that has a bright and shiny bore with sharp rifling. This pistol appears to have been carried often and shot very little. Mechanically this pistol is flawless. It functions perfectly and is very accurate. This particular gun was built in Germany. There is some finish wear on this gun and a scratch or two that can be clearly seen in the photos. There is no rust or pitting. This will make someone a great concealed carry pistol at a very good price.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Sigarms Blaser Tactical 2 (.338 Lapua Mag) w/case
postcontent:
I am letting go of a brilliant firearm. I have a Like New Blaser Tactical 2 chambered in .338 Lapua that has had 20 rounds through it. Currently it just sits in the safe and doesn't get the use that it is meant for. If you're wanting to make a 1500 yard shot or further then THIS is the perfect rifle for you. Another great feature is the fact that you can change calibers on this rifle to other popular sniper rounds in under two minutes. The barrels and bolts needed are available online. Below is some good info about the rifle, and if you have ANY questions please feel free to ask. **I would be will to do a partial trade for a top tier 1911 and/or AR**

The Tactical 2 is the most advanced version of the precision rifle developed by Blaser.
Each design element was driven by the requirement to create the best shooting platform
possible. Exceptional accuracy was one of the key principles during development, with
effective engagement ranges of 1500 meters or more, depending on caliber and
ammunition. Advanced engineering and uncompromising quality are evident in every facet
of design. The Tactical 2 is a bolt action rifle featuring Blaser’s revolutionary straight-pull
action. When the bolt is closed, the 360 degree radial collet expands into the locking
groove in the barrel – the bolt head is auto-centering and self-headspacing. The straight
pull action features no rotating parts and assures rapid reloading with minimum
movement. The rifle can easily be converted for left or right hand shooters. Interchange
calibers by replacing the barrel and bolt head, in under a minute, without special tools
and no change in accuracy. Barrels are cold hammer forged, fluted and plasma-nitrided to
provide maximum resistance against corrosion and abrasion. An M1913 Picatinny rail is
fixed to the barrel, ensuring full compatibility with a wide range of optical sighting
systems. The muzzle end is threaded for an optional muzzle brake. The receiver is
machined from aircraft grade billet aluminum alloy and is the interface for the barrel, bolt
assembly, trigger assembly and magazine. A recoil lug of hardened steel is integrated
into the receiver. The entire unit is fixed to the stock, eliminating temperature induced
distortion. The outer surface is hard anodized. The ergonomically correct stock is injection
molded out of fiber reinforced polymers and is absolutely stable, even under extreme
temperatures.

Specifications:

    Item Number: RTAC2-H27B-338
    Caliber: .338 LAPUA
    Overall Length: 46.9"
    OAL w/ Muzzle Brake: 48.4"
    Overall Height: 7.75"
    Overall Width: 2.62"
    Barrel Length: 27"
    Weight w/out Mag: 12.6 lbs
    Rifling Twist: 1 in 10"
    Rifling Grooves: 6
    Trigger Pull: 2.2 - 3.3 lb
    Magazine Capacity: 4
    MSRP: $4,474.00

It is derived from the successful "Taurus OSS" pistol we designed for the U.S. Armed Forces, but adds an external hammer that has been requested by so many of our valued customers. "STRIKE TWO" CAPABILITY - The Taurus 800 Series is now ready with "Strike Two" capability. If you have had a hard primer and the gun misfires, the 800 Series senses this and automatically gives you instant "Strike Two" capability by resetting the trigger for automatic double action re-strike. No need to do anything else, simply pull the trigger. Research indicates a 93% or better chance the round will fire on re-strike. When it fires, the 800 will automatically revert to single action by itself. If it falls on a dead primer, simply manually recharge and keep going.
